title: MiST: Understanding the Role of Mid-Stage Scientific Training in Developing Chemical Reasoning Models
summary: Large Language Models can develop reasoning capabilities through online fine-tuning with rule-based rewards. However, recent studies reveal a critical constraint: reinforcement learning succeeds only when the base model already assigns non-negligible probability to correct answers -- a property we term 'latent solvability'.
